discovery_rule.name: mtaGroupErrorEntry Discovery
discovery_rule.description: The entry holding information regarding accumulated errors for each MTA group.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupOutboundErrorCount for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Count of the number of errors of a given type that have been accumulated in association with a particular group's outbound connection activities. In the case of an SMTP client these will typically be errors reported while attempting to contact or while communicating with the remote SMTP server. In the case of X.400 these will typically be errors encountered while constructing or attempting to deliver an outgoing message.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupInternalErrorCount for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Count of the number of errors of a given type that have been accumulated in association with a particular group during internal MTA processing.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupInboundErrorCount for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Count of the number of errors of a given type that have been accumulated in association with a particular group while processing incoming messages. In the case of SMTP these will typically be errors reporting by an SMTP server to the remote client; in the case of X.400 these will typically be errors encountered while processing an incoming message.

discovery_rule.name: mtaGroupAssociationEntry Discovery
discovery_rule.description: The entry holding information regarding the associations for each MTA group.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupAssociationIndex for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Reference into association table to allow correlation of this group's active associations with the association table.

discovery_rule.name: mtaGroupEntry Discovery
discovery_rule.description: The entry associated with each MTA group.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupLoopsDetected for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: A message loop is defined as a situation where the MTA decides that a given message will never be delivered to one or more recipients and instead will continue to loop endlessly through one or more MTAs. This variable counts the number of times the MTA has detected such a situation in conjunction with something associated with this group since group creation. Note that the mechanism MTAs use to detect loops (e.g., trace field counting, count of references to this MTA in a trace field, examination of DNS or other directory information, etc.), the level at which loops are detected (e.g., per message, per recipient, per directory entry, etc.), and the handling of a loop once it is detected (e.g., looping messages are held, looping messages are bounced or sent to the postmaster, messages that the MTA knows will loop won't be accepted, etc.) vary widely from one MTA to the next and cannot be inferred from this variable.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupOldestMessageId for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Message ID of the oldest message in the group's queue. Whenever possible this should be in the form of an RFC 822 msg-id; X.400 may convert X.400 message identifiers to this form by following the rules laid out in RFC2156.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupHierarchy for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Describes how this group fits into the hierarchy. A positive value is interpreted as an mtaGroupIndex value for some other group whose variables include those of this group (and usually others). A negative value is interpreted as a group collection code: Groups with common negative hierarchy values comprise one particular breakdown of MTA activity as a whole. A zero value means that this MIB implementation doesn't implement hierarchy indicators and thus the overall group hierarchy cannot be determined.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupCreationTime for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Time since this group was first created.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupURL for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: A URL pointing to a description of the group. This information is intended to identify and briefly describe the group in a status display.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupDescription for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: A description of the group's purpose. This information is intended to identify the group in a status display.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupFailedConvertedMessages for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The number of messages for which an unsuccessful attempt was made to convert them from one form to another in this group since group creation.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupSuccessfulConvertedMessages for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The number of messages that have been successfully converted from one form to another in this group since group creation.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupName for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: A descriptive name for the group. If this group connects to a single remote MTA this should be the name of that MTA. If this in turn is an Internet MTA this should be the domain name. For an OSI MTA it should be the string encoded distinguished name of the managed object using the format defined in RFC 2253. For X.400(1984) MTAs which do not have a Distinguished Name, the RFC 2156 syntax 'mta in globalid' used in X400-Received: fields can be used.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupMailProtocol for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: An identification of the protocol being used by this group. For an group employing OSI protocols, this will be the Application Context. For Internet applications, OID values of the form {applTCPProtoID port} or {applUDPProtoID port} are used for TCP-based and UDP-based protocols, respectively. In either case 'port' corresponds to the primary port number being used by the protocol. The usual IANA procedures may be used to register ports for new protocols. applTCPProtoID and applUDPProtoID are defined in the NETWORK-SERVICES-MIB, RFC 2788.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupScheduledRetry for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The amount of time until this group is next scheduled to attempt to make an association.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupOutboundConnectFailureReason for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The failure reason, if any, for the last association attempt this group initiated. If no association attempt has been made since the MTA was initialized the value should be 'never'.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupInboundRejectionReason for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The failure reason, if any, for the last association this group refused to respond to. If no association attempt has been made since the MTA was initialized the value should be 'never'.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupFailedOutboundAssociations for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The total number associations where the group was the initiator and association establishment has failed, since group creation. Failed associations are not counted in the accumulated association totals.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupRejectedInboundAssociations for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The total number of inbound associations the group has rejected, since group creation. Rejected associations are not counted in the accumulated association totals.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupLastOutboundAssociationAttempt for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Time since the last time that this group attempted to make an outbound association for purposes of message delivery.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupLastOutboundActivity for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Time since the last time that this group had a successful outbound association for purposes of message delivery.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupLastInboundActivity for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Time since the last time that this group had an active inbound association for purposes of message reception.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupAccumulatedOutboundAssociations for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The total number of associations from the group since group creation, where the MTA was the initiator.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupAccumulatedInboundAssociations for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The total number of associations to the group since group creation, where the MTA was the responder.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupOutboundAssociations for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The number of current associations to the group, where the group is the initiator.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupInboundAssociations for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The number of current associations to the group, where the group is the responder.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupOldestMessageStored for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Time since the oldest message in this group's queue was placed in the queue.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupTransmittedRecipients for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The total number of recipients specified in all messages transmitted by this group since group creation. Recipients this MTA had no responsibility for should not be counted.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupStoredRecipients for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The total number of recipients specified in all messages currently stored in this group's queue. Recipients this MTA has no responsibility for should not be counted.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupReceivedRecipients for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The total number of recipients specified in all messages received to this group since group creation. Recipients this MTA has no responsibility for should not be counted.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupTransmittedVolume for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The total volume of messages transmitted by this group since group creation, measured in kilo-octets. This volume should include all transferred data that is logically above the mail transport protocol level. For example, an SMTP-based MTA should use the number of kilo-octets in the message header and body, while an X.400-based MTA should use the number of kilo-octets of P2 data.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupStoredVolume for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The total volume of messages currently stored in this group's queue, measured in kilo-octets. This volume should include all stored data that is logically above the mail transport protocol level. For example, an SMTP-based MTA should use the number of kilo-octets in the message header and body, while an X.400-based MTA would use the number of kilo-octets of P2 data.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupReceivedVolume for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The total volume of messages received to this group since group creation, measured in kilo-octets. This volume should include all transferred data that is logically above the mail transport protocol level. For example, an SMTP-based MTA should use the number of kilo-octets in the message header and body, while an X.400-based MTA should use the number of kilo-octets of P2 data.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupTransmittedMessages for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The number of messages transmitted by this group since group creation.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupStoredMessages for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The total number of messages currently stored in this group's queue.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupRejectedMessages for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The number of messages rejected by this group since group creation.

item_prototype.name: mtaGroupReceivedMessages for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The number of messages received to this group since group creation.

discovery_rule.name: mtaEntry Discovery
discovery_rule.description: The entry associated with each MTA.

item_prototype.name: mtaLoopsDetected for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: A message loop is defined as a situation where the MTA decides that a given message will never be delivered to one or more recipients and instead will continue to loop endlessly through one or more MTAs. This variable counts the number of times the MTA has detected such a situation since MTA initialization. Note that the mechanism MTAs use to detect loops (e.g., trace field counting, count of references to this MTA in a trace field, examination of DNS or other directory information, etc.), the level at which loops are detected (e.g., per message, per recipient, per directory entry, etc.), and the handling of a loop once it is detected (e.g., looping messages are held, looping messages are bounced or sent to the postmaster, messages that the MTA knows will loop won't be accepted, etc.) vary widely from one MTA to the next and cannot be inferred from this variable.

item_prototype.name: mtaFailedConvertedMessages for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The number of messages for which an unsuccessful attempt was made to convert them from one form to another since MTA initialization.

item_prototype.name: mtaSuccessfulConvertedMessages for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The number of messages that have been successfully converted from one form to another since MTA initialization.

item_prototype.name: mtaTransmittedRecipients for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The total number of recipients specified in all messages transmitted since MTA initialization. Recipients this MTA had no responsibility for, i.e. inactive envelope recipients or ones referred to in message headers, should not be counted. This includes messages that were transmitted to some other MTA or are waiting for delivery to an end-user or application.

item_prototype.name: mtaStoredRecipients for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The total number of recipients specified in all messages currently stored in the MTA. Recipients this MTA has no responsibility for, i.e. inactive envelope recipients or ones referred to in message headers, should not be counted. This includes messages that are awaiting transmission to some other MTA or are waiting for delivery to an end-user or application.

item_prototype.name: mtaReceivedRecipients for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The total number of recipients specified in all messages received since MTA initialization. Recipients this MTA has no responsibility for, i.e. inactive envelope recipients or ones referred to in message headers, should not be counted even if information about such recipients is available. This includes messages transmitted to this MTA from other MTAs as well as messages that have been submitted to the MTA directly by end-users or applications.

item_prototype.name: mtaTransmittedVolume for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The total volume of messages transmitted since MTA initialization, measured in kilo-octets. This volume should include all transferred data that is logically above the mail transport protocol level. For example, an SMTP-based MTA should use the number of kilo-octets in the message header and body, while an X.400-based MTA should use the number of kilo-octets of P2 data. This includes messages that were transmitted to some other MTA or are waiting for delivery to an end-user or application.

item_prototype.name: mtaStoredVolume for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The total volume of messages currently stored in the MTA, measured in kilo-octets. This volume should include all stored data that is logically above the mail transport protocol level. For example, an SMTP-based MTA should use the number of kilo-octets in the message header and body, while an X.400-based MTA would use the number of kilo-octets of P2 data. This includes messages that are awaiting transmission to some other MTA or are waiting for delivery to an end-user or application.

item_prototype.name: mtaReceivedVolume for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The total volume of messages received since MTA initialization, measured in kilo-octets. This volume should include all transferred data that is logically above the mail transport protocol level. For example, an SMTP-based MTA should use the number of kilo-octets in the message header and body, while an X.400-based MTA should use the number of kilo-octets of P2 data. This includes messages transmitted to this MTA from other MTAs as well as messages that have been submitted to the MTA directly by end-users or applications.

item_prototype.name: mtaTransmittedMessages for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The number of messages transmitted since MTA initialization. This includes messages that were transmitted to some other MTA or are waiting for delivery to an end-user or application.

item_prototype.name: mtaStoredMessages for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The total number of messages currently stored in the MTA. This includes messages that are awaiting transmission to some other MTA or are waiting for delivery to an end-user or application.

item_prototype.name: mtaReceivedMessages for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: The number of messages received since MTA initialization. This includes messages transmitted to this MTA from other MTAs as well as messages that have been submitted to the MTA directly by end-users or applications.
